tool.name: Filter Orthologs
tool.description: Retain only orthologs suitable for further analysis

param.name: filtermultiplecogs
param.label: Filter multiple COGs
param.help: Filter orthologs where multiple different COGs are assigned to various strains

param.name: filterrecombination
param.label: Filter recombination
param.help: Filter orthologs where there is evidence of recombination within an ortholog based upon phylogenetic tree inspection

param.name: retainedthreshold
param.label: Minimum % retained after trimmining alignment
param.help: Filter orthologs where less than a given percentage of sequence is retained after alignment & trimming alignment

data.name: concatemerfile
data.label: Orthologous genes concatemers of all genomes

tool.help:
This tool allows you to filter out orthologs in a number of different ways, as detailed above. In addition this tool will:
- carry over 'missing' COG annotations within ortholog files, if "Filter multiple COGs" is enabled
- concatenate the trimmed orthologous files for each genome into single concatemers files
- generate statistics on the above filtering steps
